t: Zephaniah 1
The*p word of the Lord*s that came to Zephaniah the son of Cushi, son of Gedaliah, son of Amariah, son of Hezekiah, in the days of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah.
The Coming Judgment on Judah
“I*pn will utterly sweep away everything from*ld the face of the earth,” declares the Lord.*s

“I*ln will sweep away man and beast; I*ld will sweep away the birds of the heavens and*ld the fish of the sea, and*ln the rubble with the wicked. I*ld will cut off mankind from*ld the face of the earth,” declares the Lord.*s

“I*ln will stretch out my hand against Judah and*ld against all the inhabitants of Jerusalem; and*ln I will cut off from this place the remnant of Baal and*ld the name of the idolatrous priests along with the priests,
those*ln who bow down on the roofs to*ld the host of the heavens, those*ln who bow down and swear to the Lord*s and*ld yet swear by Milcom,
those*ln who have turned back from following the Lord,*s who*ld do not seek the Lord*s or inquire of him.”
The Day of the Lord Is Near
Be*pn silent before the Lord God!*s For*ld the day of the Lord*s is near; the*ln Lord*s has prepared a sacrifice and*ld consecrated his guests.
And*ln on the day of the Lord’s*s sacrifice— “I*ln will punish the officials and the king’s sons and*ld all who array themselves in foreign attire.
On*ln that day I will punish everyone*ld who leaps over the threshold, and*ln those who fill their master’s house with*ld violence and fraud.
“On*pn that day,” declares the Lord,*s “a*ld cry will be heard from the Fish Gate, a*ln wail from the Second Quarter, a*ld loud crash from the hills.
Wail,*ln O inhabitants of the Mortar! For*ld all the traders are no more; all*ld who weigh out silver are cut off.
At*ln that time I will search Jerusalem with lamps, and*ld I will punish the men who*ln are complacent, those*ld who say in their hearts, ‘The*ln Lord*s will not do good, nor*ld will he do ill.’

Their*ln goods shall be plundered, and*ld their houses laid waste. Though*ln they build houses, they*ld shall not inhabit them; though*ln they plant vineyards, they*ld shall not drink wine from them.”
The*pn great day of the Lord*s is near, near*ld and hastening fast; the*ln sound of the day of the Lord*s is bitter; the*ld mighty man cries aloud there.
A*ln day of wrath is that day, a*ld day of distress and anguish, a*ln day of ruin and devastation, a*ld day of darkness and gloom, a*ln day of clouds and thick darkness,
a*ld day of trumpet blast and battle cry against*ln the fortified cities and*ld against the lofty battlements.

I*pn will bring distress on mankind, so*ld that they shall walk like the blind, because*ld they have sinned against the Lord;*s their*ln blood shall be poured out like dust, and*ld their flesh like dung.

Neither*ln their silver nor their gold shall*ld be able to deliver them on*ld the day of the wrath of the Lord.*s In*ln the fire of his jealousy, all*ld the earth shall be consumed; for*ln a full and sudden end he*ld will make of all the inhabitants of the earth.
Zephaniah 2
Judgment on Judah’s Enemies
Gather*pn together, yes, gather, O*ld shameless nation,

before*ln the decree takes effect— before the day passes away like chaff— before*ln there comes upon you the*ld burning anger of the Lord,*s before*ln there comes upon you the*ld day of the anger of the Lord.*s
Seek*ln the Lord,*s all you humble of the land, who*ld do his just commands; seek*ln righteousness; seek humility; perhaps*ld you may be hidden on*ld the day of the anger of the Lord.*s
For*ln Gaza shall be deserted, and*ld Ashkelon shall become a desolation; Ashdod’s*ln people shall be driven out at noon, and*ld Ekron shall be uprooted.

Woe*pn to you inhabitants of the seacoast, you*ld nation of the Cherethites! The*ln word of the Lord*s is against you, O*ld Canaan, land of the Philistines; and*ld I will destroy you until no inhabitant is left.
And*ln you, O seacoast, shall be pastures, with*ld meadows for shepherds and*ld folds for flocks.

The*ln seacoast shall become the possession of*ld the remnant of the house of Judah, on*ld which they shall graze, and*ln in the houses of Ashkelon they*ld shall lie down at evening. For*ln the Lord*s their God will be mindful of them and*ld restore their fortunes.
“I*pn have heard the taunts of Moab and*ld the revilings of the Ammonites, how*ln they have taunted my people and*ld made boasts against their territory.

Therefore,*ln as I live,” declares the Lord*s of hosts, the*ld God of Israel, “Moab*ln shall become like Sodom, and*ld the Ammonites like Gomorrah, a*ln land possessed by nettles and salt pits, and*ld a waste forever. The*ln remnant of my people shall plunder them, and*ld the survivors of my nation shall possess them.”
This*ln shall be their lot in return for their pride, because*ld they taunted and boasted against*ld the people of the Lord*s of hosts.
The*ln Lord*s will be awesome against them; for*ld he will famish all the gods of the earth, and*ln to him shall bow down, each*ld in its place, all*ld the lands of the nations.
You*pn also, O Cushites, shall*ld be slain by my sword.
And*pn he will stretch out his hand against the north and*ld destroy Assyria, and*ln he will make Nineveh a desolation, a*ld dry waste like the desert.

Herds*ln shall lie down in her midst, all*ld kinds of beasts; even*ln the owl and the hedgehog shall*ld lodge in her capitals; a*ln voice shall hoot in the window; devastation*ld will be on the threshold; for*ld her cedar work will be laid bare.

This*ln is the exultant city that*ld lived securely, that*ln said in her heart, “I*ld am, and there is no one else.” What*ln a desolation she has become, a*ld lair for wild beasts! Everyone*ln who passes by her hisses*ld and shakes his fist.
Zephaniah 3
Judgment on Jerusalem and the Nations
Woe*pn to her who is rebellious and defiled, the*ld oppressing city!
She*ln listens to no voice; she*ld accepts no correction. She*ln does not trust in the Lord;*s she*ld does not draw near to her God.
Her*pn officials within her are*ld roaring lions; her*ln judges are evening wolves that*ld leave nothing till the morning.
Her*ln prophets are fickle, treacherous men; her*ln priests profane what is holy; they*ld do violence to the law.
The*ln Lord*s within her is righteous; he*ld does no injustice; every*ln morning he shows forth his justice; each*ld dawn he does not fail; but*ld the unjust knows no shame.

“I*pn have cut off nations; their*ld battlements are in ruins; I*ln have laid waste their streets so*ld that no one walks in them; their*ln cities have been made desolate, without*ld a man, without an inhabitant.

I*ln said, ‘Surely you will fear me; you*ld will accept correction. Then*ln your dwelling would not be cut off according*ld to all that I have appointed against you.’ But*ln all the more they were eager to*ld make all their deeds corrupt.

“Therefore*pn wait for me,” declares the Lord,*s “for*ld the day when I rise up to seize the prey. For*ln my decision is to gather nations, to*ld assemble kingdoms, to*ln pour out upon them my indignation, all*ld my burning anger; for*ln in the fire of my jealousy all*ld the earth shall be consumed.
The Conversion of the Nations
“For*pn at that time I will change the speech of the peoples to*ld a pure speech, that*ln all of them may call upon the name of the Lord*s and*ld serve him with one accord.
From*ln beyond the rivers of Cush my*ld worshipers, the daughter of my dispersed ones, shall*ld bring my offering.

“On*pn that day you shall not be put to shame because*ld of the deeds by which you have rebelled against me; for*ln then I will remove from your midst your*ld proudly exultant ones, and*ln you shall no longer be haughty in*ld my holy mountain.
But*ln I will leave in your midst a*ld people humble and lowly. They*ln shall seek refuge in the name of the Lord,*s

those*ld who are left in Israel; they*ln shall do no injustice and*ld speak no lies, nor*ln shall there be found in their mouth a*ld deceitful tongue. For*ln they shall graze and lie down, and*ld none shall make them afraid.”
Israel’s Joy and Restoration
Sing*pn aloud, O daughter of Zion; shout,*ld O Israel! Rejoice*ln and exult with all your heart, O*ld daughter of Jerusalem!
The*ln Lord*s has taken away the judgments against you; he*ld has cleared away your enemies. The*ln King of Israel, the Lord,*s is in your midst; you*ld shall never again fear evil.
On*ln that day it shall be said to Jerusalem: “Fear*ln not, O Zion; let*ld not your hands grow weak.
The*ln Lord*s your God is in your midst, a*ld mighty one who will save; he*ln will rejoice over you with gladness; he*ld will quiet you by his love; he*ln will exult over you with loud singing.
I*ln will gather those of you who mourn for the festival, so*ld that you will no longer suffer reproach.
Behold,*ln at that time I will deal with*ld all your oppressors. And*ln I will save the lame and*ld gather the outcast, and*ln I will change their shame into praise and*ld renown in all the earth.

At*ln that time I will bring you in, at*ld the time when I gather you together; for*ln I will make you renowned and praised among*ld all the peoples of the earth, when*ln I restore your fortunes before*ld your eyes,” says the Lord.*s
